alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 4:13AM PDT until August 21 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Los Angeles County Hills, Valleys, and Mountains. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 406 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen with local amounts up to 7 inches in the mountains. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1.00 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will add to minor flooding already taking place. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Malibu, Wrightwood, Burbank, Griffith Park, Universal City, Van Nuys, Hollywood, Pasadena, Beverly Hills, Northridge, Mount Wilson, Santa Clarita, Downtown Los Angeles, Alhambra, Culver City, and Chatsworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
